title: Impact of Cultural Conditioning on Mathematical Problem-Solving Learning: Comparative Experimental Instructional Design

context.prior_knowledge: Proficiency in fundamental accounting concepts and mathematical problem-solving skills
context.additional_context: Learners are adult college students in their 30s with diverse cultural backgrounds, undergoing accounting education based on elementary-level math knowledge. They engage in asynchronous learning via an online platform with continuous feedback through formative assessments

learning_goals: Analyze graph/text-based learning material preferences according to cultural conditioning levels with 80% accuracy.
Propose at least three effective instructional design strategies for low-power distance (PD) and high-power distance cultural environments.
Explain the influence of cultural factors by linking learning outcomes (problem-solving scores) and cognitive load (survey ratings) data.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
